edu.ucla.sspace.common
Class SemanticSpaceWriter

java.lang.Object
  edu.ucla.sspace.common.SemanticSpaceWriter

public class SemanticSpaceWriter
extends Object

An output utility to write a SemanticSpace incrementally, one vector at a time. This class is designed for algorithms that need to write SemanticSpace instances that are too large to fit into memory but can still be computed.

Upon writing the last vector, users of this class must call #close() close to ensure that the file header is correctly written.

See Also:
SemanticSpaceIO

Creates a SemanticSpaceWriter that will write a SemanticSpace to the provided file in the specified format.

Parameters:
sspaceFile - the file to which the SemanticSpace will be written
format - the format of the semantic space
Method Detail

close

public void close()
           throws IOException
Finishes writing the SemanticSpace and writes all the associated meta data. Once this method has been called, the backing file is valid to read using SemanticSpaceIO.

Throws:
IOException

Returns the file containing the SemanticSpace
